admin_templates.template:
This is basically a wrapper to satisfy the ViewRenderer

{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_action_completed_successfully}

 {xen:raw $html}

{xen:phrase options}: {$group.title} {$group.title} + {xen:phrase add_option} {xen:phrase display_order} {xen:phrase edit_group}
{xen:phrase option_groups}: {$group.title}

{xen:phrase option_groups}

  • {$_group.title}
    •
{xen:raw $group.description}
  • {xen:phrase general_options}
  • {xen:raw $renderedOption}

<xen:radiounit label="{$preparedOption.title}" name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}][enabled]" value="{$preparedOption.option_value.{$preparedOption.option_id}}" hint="{$preparedOption.hint}">
<xen:option label="{xen:phrase disabled}" value="0" selected="{$preparedOption.option_value.enabled} == '0'" />
<xen:option label="{xen:phrase left}" value="1" selected="{$preparedOption.option_value.enabled} == '1'"> <xen:hint>{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_enable_navbar_left_explain}</xen:hint> <xen:radio name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}][left_position]" value="{xen:if $preparedOption.option_value.left_position, $preparedOption.option_value.left_position, 'end'}"> <xen:option label="{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_navbar_left_home}" value="home" /> <xen:option label="{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_navbar_left_middle}" value="middle" /> <xen:option label="{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_navbar_left_end}" value="end" /> </xen:radio> </xen:option>
<xen:option label="{xen:phrase right}" value="2" selected="{$preparedOption.option_value.enabled} == '2'"> <xen:hint>{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_enable_navbar_right_explain}</xen:hint> <xen:radio name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}][right_position]" value="{xen:if $preparedOption.option_value.right_position, $preparedOption.option_value.right_position, 'end'}"> <xen:option label="{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_navbar_right_start}" value="start" /> <xen:option label="{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_navbar_right_middle}" value="middle" /> <xen:option label="{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_navbar_right_end}" value="end" /> </xen:radio> </xen:option>
<xen:html> {xen:raw $editLink} <input type="hidden" name="{$listedFieldName}" value="{$preparedOption.option_id}" /> </xen:html>
<xen:explain>{xen:raw $preparedOption.explain}</xen:explain> </xen:radiounit>

{xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_redirecting} {xen:escape $title, false} {xen:escape $title, false}
{xen:raw $message} {xen:phrase dbtech_vbshout_redirecting}
{$title}: {xen:if $description, {$description}, ' '}

option.default_value:
Sorry, DragonByte Shout is unavailable at the moment while we are testing some functionality.

We will be back soon...

phrases.phrase:
Are you sure you want to delete the Button called '{param1}'?
({param2}: {param3})

{param4} This action can not be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete the Command called '{param1}'?
({param2}: {param3})

{param4} This action can not be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete the Shoutbox Instance called '{param1}'?
({param2}: {param3})

{param4} This action can not be undone.

All shouts from this Instance will be deleted!

It seems like there's a pending upgrade for DragonByte Shout. The mod's functionality has been limited to prevent errors during the upgrade process.
Please complete the upgrade to restore full functionality.

If you believe you are seeing this message in error, please delete the following file from your server: {param1}
Enable Active Users Block <dfn>This setting controls the display of an additional block next to the main Shouts area, that lists all currently Active Users in the Shoutbox.</dfn>
Activity Status When this icon is lit, you are active and can be seen by others in the Shoutbox. Click the icon to toggle Invisible mode.

(Pro) Disabled Activity Triggers Tick the boxes for the actions that should not trigger users to appear as active.
Note: Shouting always triggers the user to appear as active unless they have enabled invisible mode.
Either your browser does not support AJAX, or the forum administrator has chosen to disable AJAX. DragonByte Shout cannot run under these conditions.
Disallow "ALL CAPS SHOUTS" Enabling this setting will use vBulletin's Prevent 'SHOUTING' setting to check the message for "all caps" shouts.
Allow Smilies in Shouts <dfn>Allow smilies to be used in shouts?</dfn>
This shout has already been reported.
Enable Alternating Shout Colours <dfn>Turning this on will alternate shout background colours in the shoutbox.</dfn>
Anonymise Links <dfn>If enabled, will remove the referrer information from links by integrating with Anonym.To</dfn>
The AOP directory either doesn't exist or isn't writable.

[DBTech] Advanced Post Thanks / Like Marker Interval <dfn>This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox. For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] given / received of each APTL button.</dfn>
(Pro) Archive Link <dfn>Choose how you would like the link to the Archive to appear in the shoutbox.</dfn>
(Pro) Archive "Top Shouters" Count <dfn>Specify how many users you wish to be the maximum displayed users in the Top Shouters area.</dfn>
Are you sure you wish to ban / unban this user?
Do you want to join the Chat Room: %roomname%? You were invited by %username%.
Are you sure you wish to leave this chat room?
Are you sure you wish to remove this user from this Chat Room?
Are you sure you wish to disband this Chat Room?
Are you sure you wish to ignore / unignore this user?
Are you sure you wish to prune all shouts from this user?

Are you sure you wish to reset all Shout style customisations?
This cannot be undone!
Are you sure you wish to delete this shout?
Are you sure you wish to silence / unsilence this user?

(Pro) Auto-Delete Shouts Enter how long (in hours) before shouts are automatically deleted.
0 = Disable
24 = 1 Day
168 = 1 Week
672 = 1 Month

Auto-Display Shoutbox This setting controls whether the Shoutbox will automatically be added to the "Forum Home".
Selecting "Disabled" means you need to add a variable to all relevant templates manually.

If you wish it to display on all pages, add the code as per the description of the "Varname" setting above to the navbar template.
Auto Join <dfn>If no, this chatroom will display in a special tab where users can join the chat room at will.</dfn>
(Pro) Avatars Enabled (Archive) <dfn>Turning this setting on will display a heavily resized version of the shouter's avatar next to their name.</dfn>
(Pro) Avatars Enabled <dfn>Turning this setting on will display a heavily resized version of the shouter's avatar next to their name.</dfn>
(Pro) Avatar Height (Archive) <dfn>This setting controls the height of the avatars displayed in the shoutbox.</dfn>
(Pro) Avatar Height <dfn>This setting controls the height of the avatars displayed in the shoutbox.</dfn>
(Pro) Avatar Width (Archive) <dfn>This setting controls the width of the avatars displayed in the shoutbox.</dfn>
(Pro) Avatar Width <dfn>This setting controls the height of the avatars displayed in the shoutbox.</dfn>
You are banned from the Shoutbox.

Blog Marker Interval <dfn>This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox. For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] blogs.</dfn>
Below, you can manage all the custom Buttons you have added to the various instances.
You don't have permissions to access this chat room.
You cannot access the Chat Room list.
You don't have permission to manage bans.
You don't have permission to prune shouts.
You cannot remove yourself from a Chat Room.
You cannot remove users from this Chat Room.
You don't have permissions to Silence / Unsilence.
You don't have permission to manage the Sticky Note.
You cannot create a new Chat Room.
You cannot delete the last entry in this table.
Can Search Archive Has no effect unless Can View Archive is set to Yes.
Can View Archive <dfn>Even if the usergroup can't view the Shoutbox, it may still view the Archive via this setting.</dfn>
Your shout is too long ({param1} out of an allowed {param2} characters).
Below, you can manage all aspects of the Chat Rooms you have created for your DragonByte Shout users.
If you wish to use a two-stage command, e.g. /slap Belazor, use {1} where you want the replacement to occur.
Command Log Viewer (page {param1}/{param2}) | There are {param3} total log entries.

This interface lets you define new Custom Commands.

Using the Parameter flag will let you type an additional parameter after the command to produce advanced dynamic messages.

Example:

Command: /slap
Output: /me slaps {1} with a large, smelly tuna fish!
Use Parameter: Checked

Not having the Parameter checked, the {1} (and thus, the output) will be printed incorrectly in the Shoutbox.
Below, you can review and manage all aspects regarding your global custom commands.
This thread contains the shoutbox conversation from shoutid {param1} to shoutid {param2}.
The vBShout product has been deactivated by an administrator.

Shoutbox Deployment This setting controls which pages show the Shoutbox. Remove the contents of this setting to have the Shoutbox display on all pages.

Separate each script with a comma.
The directory {param1} is not writable by the web server.
If you'd like to completely hide the shoutbox, tick this box.
Choose the display order for this chat tab.
Editing a shout. Press ESC to cancel editing.
Enabled Editor Toolbars <dfn>Choose the Editor Tools that are enabled for usage in the Shoutbox.</dfn>
Enable "Chat Access" Page <dfn>With this setting you can enable / disable the "Chat Access" page.</dfn>
Allows the Shoutbox to send notifications to your desktop for certain events.

Enable Context Menu This will allow you to globally disable the advanecd context menu when clicking on a member's name in the Shoutbox.
Enabling the context menu adds a large amount of data to each AJAX request, but enables quick access to member and moderator actions.
(Pro) Enable PM Notifications <dfn>When someone sends a Private Message on the forums, vBShout can send a shoutbox PM to the recipient.</dfn>

(Pro) Enable PMs The Shoutbox has the ability for users to send Private Messages between themselves.
If you wish to disable the PM system, you can do so here.
If you don't want the Bold button to appear, you can hide it here.
If you don't want the Clear button to appear, you can hide it here.
If you don't want the Color selector to appear, you can hide it here.
If you don't want the Detach button to appear, you can hide it here.
If you don't want the Font selector to appear, you can hide it here.
Enable Invite Sound <dfn>Will play an audio cue every time a new chat room invite is received.</dfn>
If you don't want the Italic button to appear, you can hide it here.
You may disable sending and receiving /me shouts with this setting.
This will enable a navbar tab on the left hand side (where the "Home" and "Forums" tabs are).
This will enable a navbar tab on the right hand side (where the "Alert" and "Inbox" tabs are).
If you don't want to see Notifications for various events happening around the forum, you can disable them here.
You may choose to display every shout with the same Shout Style customisations as your own.
If you do not want to send or receive private messages in the Shoutbox, you may disable the private messaging system.
Enable PM Sound <dfn>Will play an audio cue every time a new forum Private Message is received.</dfn>
Enable Shout Sound <dfn>Will play an audio cue every time a new shout is made.</dfn>
If you don't want the Size selector to appear, you can hide it here.
If you don't want the Smilies button to appear, you can hide it here.
You may hide the various System Messages generated by Shoutbox Managers here.
(Pro) Enable System Messages If you wish to globally disable printing messages from SYSTEM in the Shoutbox, you may do so here.
If you don't want the Underline button to appear, you can hide it here.
You are currently flagged as Idle. Click here to un-flag.

Minimum Time Between Shouts This setting controls how long a user must wait after submitting a shout before submitting a new one. Having a delay will prevent flooding.

Set the value to 0 to disable this feature.
Shoutbox Height <dfn>Specify how many pixels should be the height of the Shoutbox.</dfn>
(Pro) Shoutbox Height (Detached) <dfn>Specify how many pixels should be the height of the Shoutbox while in Detached mode.</dfn>
If the administrator has enabled alternating shout colours and you do not wish to see them, you can hide them with this setting.
If the administrator has enabled shoutbox avatars and you do not wish to see them, you can hide them with this setting.

Idle Timeout Enter the number of seconds until users are flagged as Idle and won't see any new shouts / notices until they either un-idle themselves, or post a shout.

Set the value to 0 to disable this feature.

In addition to this interface, you can ignore / unignore users directly in the Shoutbox by typing the following commands:

/ignore Username
/unignore Username
You have used too many images in your shout ({param1} out of a maximum of {param2}).
Include BBCode <dfn>Whether the downloaded shouts should include the BBCode formatting or be plain text only.</dfn>
Below, you can manage every aspect of the Shoutbox Instances available to you.
Invalid Chat Room Name. Usage: /createchat roomname
Invalid shout ID, it may have been deleted already.
Disallow "Invisible Mode" <dfn>Enabling this setting will prevent people from clicking the activity icon to flag themselves as invisible.</dfn>
Enabling this setting will play a sound when you receive an invitation to a Chat Room.
Invite Sound <dfn>The sound that's played when the user receives a new Chat Room invite.</dfn>
Is Auto Idle <dfn>This setting overrides the vBulletin Options setting for Auto-Idle.</dfn>
Is Shoutbox Manager <dfn>Shoutbox Managers are exempt from many of the restrictions imposed on normal users, and can see the Shoutbox while it's offline.</dfn>
Is Protected Group <dfn>If yes, this usergroup cannot be banned or ignored by anybody.</dfn>
I just sent you a forum PM: [url={param1}/private.php?{param2}do=showpm&pmid={param3}]{param4}[/url]

(Pro) Deep Logging This feature logs every single shout made, and keeps a record of both shouts when a shout is edited.

Enabling this feature may incur a small performance hit.

(Pro) Deep Logging: Include System Messages Whether messages from the SYSTEM are logged when Deep Logging is active.
These messages help pinpoint when the Shoutbox was pruned or when somebody edits the Notice.
Logging <dfn>Choose what Shoutbox Manager command(s) should be logged.</dfn>
Log Entries to Show Per Page
DragonByte Tech: vBShout - Shoutbox Manager Permissions
Shouts To Display (Archive) <dfn>Controls how many shouts are shown per page in the archive.</dfn>

Maximum Characters Per Shout Shouts that contain more characters than the value specified here will be shortened before submission.

Set the value to 0 to use the Maximum Characters Per Post value found in Message Posting and Editing Options.

Maximum Chat Rooms Per User This is the maximum amount of chat rooms each user can create.
0 = Unlimited

Maximum Images Per Shout When a new shout is submitted or edited vBShout will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to use the Maximum Images Per Post setting found in the Message Posting and Editing Options.

Shouts To Display Controls how many shouts are shown in the Shoutbox on your configured pages.

Setting this number too high will have a serious impact on performance.

(Pro) Shouts To Display (Detached) Controls how many shouts are shown in the Shoutbox when in Detached mode.

Setting this number too high will have a serious impact on performance.
Maximum [SIZE] <dfn>If the "Allow Size BB Code" is checked, you may use this setting to limit the maximum value allowed.</dfn>
You may not edit others' shouts.
You may not edit your own shouts.
You do not have the required permissions to post a shout.

Member Marker Interval This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox.
For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] members.

[DBTech] Advanced User Tagging - Post Mention Marker Interval <dfn>This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox. For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] AUT post mentions.</dfn>
(Pro) Minimum Posts Per Day <dfn>The minimum amount of posts per day (as seen in the member profile) before someone of any usergroup can access the Shoutbox.</dfn>
(Pro) Minimum Posts <dfn>The minimum amount of posts before someone of any usergroup can access the Shoutbox.</dfn>

Missing Required Information: {param1}.

Click here to add the missing information.
You must wait at least %time% seconds between shouts. It has been %time2% seconds since your last shout.

Shoutbox Notices Choose what events produce a Notice for a user in the shoutbox.

Note: The New Threads and New Replies requires you to also enable these Notices on a per-forum basis, in the Notifications section of the vBShout AdminCP menu group.
has just commented on the blog {param1}
has just posted a new Issue: {param1} in project {param2}
has just replied to the Issue: {param1} in project {param2}
has just replied to the thread {param1}
There are currently no users chatting.
You haven't created any buttons, why don't you add some?
You have not created any Chat Rooms. Why don't you create some?
There are currently no users chatting in this chat room.
You have no defined global commands. Why not create some?
You currently have no custom commands defined.
You are currently not ignoring any users.
You have no defined Shoutbox Instances.
You do not have permission to view this page.
No shouts matched your search query.
Shoutbox Optimisation <dfn>Turning this on will drastically reduce the resources consumed by the Shoutbox.</dfn>
Please enter a value using {count} characters or fewer.
Your intended recipient has disabled Private Messaging.
You have disabled the PM system in your user options.
The administrators have disabled the PM system for your usergroup.
Enabling this setting will play a sound when you receive a new Private Message.
The Private Message system is disabled.
PM Sound <dfn>The sound that's played when the user receives a new Private Message.</dfn>

Post Marker Interval This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox.
For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] posts.
This user is protected from being Ignored / Silenced / Banned.

[DBTech] vBQuiz - Quizzes Made Interval <dfn>This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox. For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] quizzes made.</dfn>

[DBTech] vBQuiz - Quizzes Taken Interval <dfn>This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox. For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] quizzes taken.</dfn>

[DBTech] Advanced User Tagging - Post Quote Marker Interval <dfn>This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox. For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] AUT post quotes.</dfn>

Shoutbox Refresh Speed This setting controls how often (in seconds) the Shoutbox updates while a user is not posting a shout and hasn't been flagged as Idle.

Setting this value too low will have a serious impact on performance for forums with many concurrent online users.
See Admin Help for more information.

(Pro) Shoutbox Refresh Speed - Idle This setting controls how often (in minutes) the Shoutbox updates while an is flagged as Idle.
0 = Disable

Setting this value too low will cause a performance hit.
Are you sure you wish to remove this user from the Chat Room?
This will reset all users' Shout Style customisations to the default values.

(Pro) Shout Input Area Default Location Choose the default location for the shout input area.
Users can choose to override this setting.
(Pro) Enabled Shoutbox Tabs <dfn>Here, you can choose which of the default Shoutbox Tabs you wish to show.</dfn>
The Shoutbox has just been pruned!

You can change the size (in pixels) of the Shoutbox here.
0 = Forum Default

You can change the size (in pixels) of the Shoutbox while in Detached mode here.
0 = Forum Default
Shout Default Display Order <dfn>Choose the default display order for shouts.</dfn>

Shout Marker Interval <dfn>This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox. For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] shouts.</dfn>
Enabling this setting will play a sound when a new Shout is posted in every active chat you are participating in, except for the one you are currently viewing.
All users had their lifetime shouts reset!
You can change the location of the Shout Input area here.
Shout Sound <dfn>The sound that gets played when a new Shout is made.</dfn>
Enable Sounds <dfn>This setting lets you control the Sounds across all instances, regardless of their individual sound configuration.</dfn>
(Pro) Play Sounds While Idle <dfn>This setting controls whether sounds play even if the user is flagged as Idle.</dfn>
The Sticky Note has been updated!

[DBTech] Advanced User Tagging - Thread Tags Marker Interval <dfn>This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox. For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] AUT thread tags.</dfn>

Manually Display Shoutbox This setting controls which templates show the Shoutbox.
You need to add the following text to the templates you input here:

{vb:raw vbshout}

Separate each template name with a comma.

Thread Marker Interval This setting controls how often a Notification is inserted into the Shoutbox.
For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] threads.
(Pro) Time Format <dfn>Input the format you wish the timestamps in the shoutbox to use. Leave blank for no timestamp.</dfn>
(Pro) Time Format (Old Shouts) <dfn>Input the format you wish the timestamps in the shoutbox to use if the shouts are more than 24 hours old. Leave blank for no timestamp.</dfn>
You cannot create any more Chat Rooms.
You have included a total of {param1} images in your message. The maximum number that you may include is {param2}.
The destination directory is not writeable.
The uploaded file is too large for the server to process.
The contents of the uploaded image do not match the file's extension.
The uploaded file does not have an allowed extension.
The uploaded file is not a valid image.
The uploaded image contains invalid content. Please upload a different image.
The uploaded file was not an image as expected.
The selected users have been unbanned from the Shoutbox.
If you wish to use a two-stage command, e.g. /slap Belazor, tick this box.

Varname For instance, if the varname is instance1 then the code to place in your template of choice is:
<!--XFSHOUT.instance1-->
{param1} is a Shoutbox Manager. They cannot be ignored or banned.
{param1} is a member of a protected usergroup. They may not be ignored or banned.
{param1} has had their lifetime shouts reset!
Whether the Shoutbox will post a notice whenever someone replies to a thread in this forum.

Whether the Shoutbox will post a notice whenever someone creates a new thread in this forum.

Note that this feature won't work with threads appearing in a forum in any other way than the New Thread button.

If you are performing version upgrades on a large forum, or you are adding new features, you may want to temporarily turn vBShout off.
Use the next setting to control the message users will see if they try to access vBShout while it's closed.
Controls which BB Code tags are allowed to be used in shouts.
Allowed BB Code Tags in Shoutbox
Whether smilies can be used in shouts. Turning this setting off will show them as their respective shortcuts, like :) and :D.

Integrated With Title is the default behaviour, and it means clicking on the title of the Shoutbox takes you to the Archive.
Separated From Title will add a [Archive] link next to the Shoutbox title.
You can limit how many users are displayed in the Top X Shouters area of the Archive here.

This setting controls where, if at all, the Shoutbox will automatically display on all scripts you have defined in the above setting.

If you wish to have the Shoutbox displayed somewhere else on your page, you may do so by changing this setting to Disabled, and following the instruction in the setting below.

This setting is mostly helpful if you either choose to display the Shoutbox to unregistered users, or if you have a lot of users that don't take part in the Shoutbox.
It can also help reduce server load if your resource consumption on non-shouting users is too high even with a low Idle Timeout value.

The text that is presented when the vBShout is closed.

Shoutbox Managers will still be able to access the vBShout.

You can define usergroups as Shoutbox Manager via the Usergroup Manager.
In the Forum tab, there's a Community menu. This setting controls whether vBShout should integrate itself in this menu.

For security reasons, you may wish to hide the version of the product you are running.

It is recommended that you keep your product up to date.

Choose the Editor Tools that are enabled for usage in the Shoutbox.
Disabling these editors will also hide any shout style customisations a user has chosen with this editor.

There's two ways a user can send a Private Message in the Shoutbox.
By clicking on a username to open a new chat tab in which messages will only be viewable by the sender and recipient.
By using the following command: /pm [username]; [message].

This setting lets you disable the PM system.
Messages from the SYSTEM user carries information about when (part of) the Shoutbox has been pruned, or when the Notice has changed.
This setting controls how long a user must wait after submitting a shout before submitting a new one. Having a delay will prevent flooding the Shoutbox, and potentially crashing it for everybody.
When you resize the detached Shoutbox with this setting, the input area for posting shouts follows in sync.
When you resize the Shoutbox with this setting, the input area for posting shouts follows in sync.

Enter the number of seconds until users are flagged as Idle and won't see any new shouts / notices until they either un-idle themselves, or post a shout.
The lower this value, the less resources will people who are not actively participating in the shoutbox consume.

This setting controls which scripts the Shoutbox can be shown on.

If you are looking for how to manually make the Shoutbox appear, please see the Admin Help entry for the next setting.
When the Deep Logging is enabled, it can also potentially log System messages, controlled by this setting.

Duplicating shouts upon insert / edit will result in one additional query being ran during these operations.
If the connection to your database server is slow, leaving this setting disabled will provide the best performance.

vBShout supports multiple Shoutbox Manager commands. This setting controls which actions, if any, are logged.

Turning on logging for a specific command will incur a small performance hit as an additional database query is ran to save the command to the log table.

Shouts that contain more characters than the value specified here will be shortened before submission. Any attempt at defeating this system will result in an error message after submitting the shout.

Limiting the amount of characters in a shout prevents one shout from taking up the entire view port of the shoutbox.

When a new shout is submitted or edited vBShout will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here. Any attempt at including more images will result in an error message after submitting the shout.

Limiting the amount of images can help reduce the time the browser takes to display the shout properly.

This setting controls how many shouts are loaded in the Shoutbox while it's in Detached mode.
While it may seem like a good idea to let users view entire conversations at once in the Shoutbox, loading too many shouts will slow the Shoutbox down for each user, and should be avoided.

This setting controls how many shouts are loaded in the Shoutbox, and also how many shouts are showed per page in the Archive.
While it may seem like a good idea to let users view entire conversations at once in the Shoutbox, loading too many shouts will slow the Shoutbox down for each user, and should be avoided.

If the "Allow Size BB Code" is checked, you may use this setting to limit the maximum value allowed. Any attempt at using a higher value will result in the attempted value being replaced with the value of this setting.

By default, vBShout places a new navigation tab next to the Settings tab.
This setting controls the visibility of that tab, but the vBShout itself is still accessible.

The Shoutbox can automatically insert notices in the chat when certain events happen.
Unchecking an event here will globally disable that event, regardless of the user's settings.

Please note that you need to explicitly enable New Threads and New Posts notices in the Forum Manager for each forum you wish to send these notices for.

In order to reduce the amount of resources the Shoutbox requires, you can use the File System method of optimisation.

Remember to CHMOD the /dbtech/vbshout/aop directory to 0777.

For instance, setting this to 50 will cause a notification to be inserted at 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, [...] posts.
10 will cause a notification at 10, 20, 30, 40, [...] posts.
In the Forum tab, there's a Quick Links menu. This setting controls whether vBShout should integrate itself in this menu.

The lower this value is set to, the more of an "instant messenger" feel is present in the Shoutbox.
However, it will drastically increase resource usage due to the increased frequency with which the shouts are refreshed.

You should experiment with this setting and keep an eye on the Shoutbox and server load as your forum grows, to ensure this setting is not too high or too low.
Re-naming your shoutbox helps create an sense of individuality with your installation of vBShout. Giving it an easy to write and catchy name will certainly become a meme on your forum.
Whether you'd like shouts to be ordered as a normal conversation would go, or to have the newest shouts displayed on top of the page.

From time to time, you may want to turn the modification off to the public while you perform maintenance, update versions, etc. When you turn the modification off, visitors will see a message that states that it is temporarily unavailable.
If you have purchased a Branding Free licence, you may enter the key found in its Readme file here.
Reason For Turning The Modification Off
The text that is presented when the modification is turned off.
If you disable this, the version number you are running will not be shown to the public.
If you have entered a valid Branding Free Key but would like to show support to DragonByte by allowing this product to display its branding still, you can enable this setting.
You can optionally enter your DBTech affiliate ID here. This is your user ID over at the DragonByte Tech Forums. You can read more about the affiliate system here.

From time to time, you may want to turn vBShout off to the public while you perform maintenance, update versions, etc. When you turn your vBShout off, visitors will see a message that states that it is temporarily unavailable in place of the normal Shoutbox.
Shoutbox Managers will still be able to access the shoutbox.
Shoutbox Instance Moderators can export threads to this forum to easily create discussion threads of
If you have purchased a Branding Free licence, you may enter the key found in its Readme file here.

The text that is presented when vBShout is turned off.
Shoutbox Managers will still be able to access the shoutbox.
Whether a link should be inserted into the Community drop-down.
If you disable this, the version number you are running will not be shown to the public.

DragonByte Shout can use the HTML 5 <audio> tag to play back its audio, which has improved browser capabilities for modern and mobile browsers.

Older browsers may not work correctly with this, and you lose the ability to easily customise the various shout sounds.

If you wish to revert to the old behaviour (which has major playback issues in Google Chrome, amongst others) you can disable this setting.
Choose what level of integration should be enabled when viewing the Member List.
Whether a new tab should be added to the navigation bar.
If you do not wish to support DragonByte Tech by displaying the HiVelocity Hosting affiliate link, you can disable it with this setting.
(Lite) Disable "Runs best on HiVelocity Hosting" Link
Whether a link should be added to the Quick Links drop-down.
You can optionally enter your DBTech affiliate ID here. This is your user ID over at the DragonByte Tech Forums. You can read more about the affiliation system here.
Turn this on if some of your characters display broken.

Numeric representation of the current version.
Leave this setting alone.

Textual representation of the current version.
Leave this setting alone.

The file '/dbtech/vbshout/aop.php' is not writable.
Please log in to the FTP server and CHMOD this file to 0666.
The offset needed in order to properly align the active tab in the Shoutbox.
The offset needed in order to properly align the inactive tabs in the Shoutbox.

Whether the users in this usergroup can use the /ban and /unban commands.

This command is only available to Shoutbox Managers.

Whether a user can edit shouts others have posted.
Any edited shouts will be logged in the Command Log, available to Shoutbox Managers.

Whether a user can edit shouts they themselves posted.
Any edited shouts will be logged in the Command Log, available to Shoutbox Managers.

Whether the users in this usergroup can use the /prune command.

This command is only available to Shoutbox Managers.
If the usergroup can view the Archive, this setting controls whether they will also be able to search it.

Controls whether users are allowed to post new shouts in the shoutbox.
This does not affect a user's Notifications (New Thread / New Reply).

Whether the users in this usergroup can use the /silence and /unsilence commands.

This command is only available to Shoutbox Managers.

Whether the users in this usergroup can use the /sticky and /editsticky commands.

This command is only available to Shoutbox Managers.

Controls whether a user can view the Archive.
This setting is independent of the Can View Shoutbox setting.

Controls whether a user can see the Shoutbox on its enabled pages.
Users may still view the Archive if the below setting is enabled.

Shoutbox Managers are exempt from many of the restrictions imposed on normal users, and can see the Shoutbox while it's offline.

Users in this group have no restrictions as to the number of characters in their post.
Protected usergroups cannot be ignored or banned by any user, not even Shoutbox Managers.
